article.headline: Charleston Southern 76, Presbyterian 71
article.story: CHARLESTON, S.C. -- Jamarco Warren scored 22 points and Kelvin Martin had his sixth double-double of the season as Charleston Southern held off Presbyterian 76-71 on Thursday night. Martin had 19 points, 13 rebounds and three steals for the Buccaneers (10-8, 4-2 Big South Conference), who have won four of their past five and evened the series against the Blue Hose at 7-7. The Buccaneers led by 15 in the first half and 34-24 at the break. Presbyterian (8-10, 2-4) closed to 54-52 on Pierre Miller's 3-pointer with 7:20 left, but Jeremy Sexton hit a 3 and Martin's three-point play rebuilt an eight-point cushion. Presbyterian again got within two points at 70-68 on Khalid Mutakabbir's 3-pointer with 23 seconds left. Charleston Southern hit 6 of 6 foul shots in the final 21 seconds, with Warren sinking four, to seal the win. Mutakabbir had a career-high 24 points for the Blue Hose.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
